content.description: A toy train moves along a straight set up on a table. The position x(t) of the train at the time t seconds is measured in centimeters from the center of the track. At time t=1 , the train is 6 centimeters to the left of the center, so x(1)=−6 . For 0≤t≤4 , the velocity of the train at the time t is given by v(t)=3t2−12, where v(t) is measured in centimeters per second.
content.question: For 0  ≤ t ≤ 4 , find x(t) .

topic.text: 8.2: Connecting Position, Velocity, and Acceleration Functions Using Integrals

skill.text: Skill 1.D: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the relationship between concepts (e.g., rate of change and accumulation) or processes (e.g., differentiation and its inverse process, anti-differentiation) to solve problems.
